page.title: 16HARWICH'S HISTORIC REDOUBT
page.content: THE REDOUBT IS PART OF THE MARTELLO TOWER DEFENCES WHICH WENT FROM ALDEBURGH TO SEAFORD. SMALL TOWERS HAD ONLY ONE GUN BUT THE BIGGER REDOUBTS HAD UP TO 10. THE HARWICH REDOUBT WAS BUILT IN 1808 AND THE GRANITE BROUGHT IN BY BARGE. IT WAS BUILT ON A HILL AND A HOUSE HAD TO BE KNOCKED DOWN TO BUILD IT. THEY EVEN HAD TO MOVE THE ROAD TO LONDON TO BUILD IT! THE REDOUBT HAS A DRY MOAT. THOUSANDS OF TONS OF EARTH WAS BROUGH FROM BATHSIDE ON DONKEYS TO SURROUND THE REDOUBT WITH EARTHWORKS. THE REDOUBT TOOK THREE YEARS TO BUILD AND COST ABOUT Â£50,000. IT IS NOW A MUSEUM AND IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC EVERY SUNDAY. THE HARWICH SOCIETY HAS COMPLETED MUCH OF THE RESTORATION WORK.MONEY COMES FROM AN ANNUAL FETE.
